description: We were looking for a Mexican restaurant in the Castro area of San Francisco and stumbled upon the newly opened Tacos Club. Everything was made with fresh ingredients and cooked to order on the spot. We could not have been happier. Make sure you save room for dessert. The flan is the best I have ever tasted!
author: D L.

description: Best burrito I have had in the city yet.  Local organic ingredients and friendly staff.  Mike was very courteous in serving up our order.  Open late too!
author: Jason T.

description: Over priced!!! I ordered food here for pick up. One of the things I ordered was chips and salsa. Brought my food back to work and found there was no salsa. I called and they could care less. Never again!!!
author: Dani G.

description: This place ROCKS! With the friendly staff  and "at ease" dining environment, one can enjoy a REAL and great meal- AUTHENTIC in every way!! Antonio and his team is always friendly and always sets the mood. Whether it's Taco-Tuesday or that late night bar snack, one can't go wrong with Tacos Club.
author: Ronaldo T.

description: I haven't been to this place since I first moved into the neighborhood in 2010.  I went last week for Taco Tuesday.  There is enough variety on their taco menu.   I highly recommend the Pastor.  I'd probably say that this place is the best taco place in the neighborhood.
author: Perry P.

description: Ay, que rico! Tacos--real tacos, with soft or crispy corn tortillas, succulent fillings, and snappy salsas--are a revered street food on both sides of the border. In TACOS, Mark Miller adds a chef's sensibility to this vibrant primer for building delicious and authentic tacos.
author: Correalew F.

description:
First time here since it was La Fajita Grill. So glad to know the food is just as good, and the decor is greatly improved. Tastiest Mexican food in the Castro (especially the cactus burrito). And the food is organic and locally sourced as well. 

They got rid of all the cold tile and metal - now it's all warm and inviting. 

My only disappointment was that the burrito wasn't grilled after being wrapped in the tortilla - I love I when they do that and I liked that about La Fajita Grill
author: Thomas F.

description: Don't come for Taco Tuesday.  I waited 45 minutes for 3 tacos.  They lost my order completely, and if I had said nothing they would never have noticed and I wouldn't have eaten at all.  Many other customers were also testy, having waited ridiculous times.  The tacos were tasty though, thus the extra, second star.
author: David W.

description: We visited SF and we were searching for an authentic Mexican place. Taco Club has really really great food, and everything is house-made, so you should eat there.
author: Thomas J H.

description: WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!!!!!!!!!!        So I order a chicken burrito and I also asked for a medium spicy salsa and extra chips on the side..  order came to 13.00..   no big deal..   So I am walking down Market street and I decide I want to have a few chips..  and that is exactly what was in the bag with TWO tiny containers of salsa!!!!!!     So I go back to the taco club to see what happened and the young guy behind the counter had NO understanding as to what I was talking about.   I told him that I had ordered a medium order of spicy salsa and extra chips and the burrito was only 8.00 so WHY did the order come to 13.00????   He said that orders were "subject to change" on the menu?????   WHAT DOES THAT MEAN??    So of course I did NOT get what I wanted so I asked for a refund..   got the refund..   young man behind the counter VERY argumentative with me throughout the WHOLE BAD experience of dealing with this situation!!    VERY uncomfortable and would not recommend to anyone..   BAD BUSINESS.........       NO STARS............     horrible people to deal with!!
author: Martin C.

description: Good food overall.  Friendly but annoying cashier... I really dont care about your opinion of my itinerary for the day but whatever. Had the tacos flautas and Quesada all were good and portions were nice. Give it a try.
author: Johnfucious S.

description: I live in the neighborhood and thought I should try a new place for fish tacos. This is NOT the place to go even though the reviews here are ridiculously positive. I paid over $10 for two fish tacos with no side. what the hell?? I paid extra for beans and rice and they were below average. A much better and cheaper place is El Castillito on Church. I guess it doesn't pay to stray from what you know is good food.
author: greg j.

description: This is NOT the same taqueria that used to be here. This new incarnation serves exceptional gourmet Mexican!  The chile colorado and the mole enchiladas are some of the best I've had.  And the tacos and burritos are que rico too for those of you that still want that taqueria experience.  You will be happy you tried this new restaurant.
author: Kerry D.

description: I love the weekend brunch. The taco egg scramble is my favorite. Also, Taco Tuesdays are great!
author: Fabian M.

description: stopped in for breakfast randomly on our way to twin peaks. service was great, food was amazing...
author: Bugsy S.

description: so check this out .. i come here once a week .. the people that work here are all extremely friendly .. they know my order by heart .. i come in, they ask me if i want my usual and that is what seperates this place from others .. they are great !! so the food .. okay, it's not like other places .. they kinda got their own flavor & i like that .. but bottom line it's all about the friendly & courteous service here .. so personal .. & for me it's convient since it's a half a block from my house .. as long as they keep up that friendly environment i will continue to be a regular there ... one worker in particular is extremely friendly on the eyes .. just had to include that in here ..
author: Michael P.

description: Come for lunch often. Their grilled fish tacos are bomb! The staff is always efficient and friendly!
author: Oliver K.

description: a great place, with great healthy food.. best Mexican in the City !
author: Yousef H.

description: Much-needed overhaul of La Fajita is good, great menu and the food is fine but I fear the pricing is going to put them under - seriously, $11 for a super burrito and $3 for a Mexican coke?  You might command that premium if the food or ambiance was noticeably better than the rest, but I can think of a least a couple of other tacquerias nearby that I actually prefer and which are a lot cheaper.  Very friendly service though.
author: Jeff P.

description: Amazing mole burrito.  So tasty!   Friendly, upgraded, fresh and organic food.  5 thumbs up!
author: J P.

description: Decent Food. A little expensive. Chips are really good - when they are fresh and they remember to salt them.
author: Daniel B.
